thread.title: Kellyanne Conway claims she didn't tweet Valentines Day message to a white nationalist
thread.title_full: Kellyanne Conway claims she didn't tweet Valentines Day message to a white nationalist | The Independent

author: Maya Oppenheim
title: Kellyanne Conway claims she didn't tweet Valentines Day message to a white nationalist
text:
Donald Trump ‚Äôs senior adviser‚Äôs Twitter account not only retweeted a white nationalist but also composed a Valentines Day message to them.
Kellyanne Conway ‚Äôs tweet was deleted after others noticed it, with the senior advisor denying she had sent the message. Distancing herself from the blunder, Ms Conway said she had never heard of the white nationalist account and ‚Äúdenounced‚Äù it.
The account, which is called Lib Hypocrisy, explicitly labels itself as white nationalist. Its Twitter image is a cartoon blond girl wearing a ‚ÄúUS Border control‚Äù hat and its Twitter bio reads ‚ÄúHate Anti-American Liberals, Marxists & Commies‚Äù and uses the hashtags ‚Äúwhite identity‚Äù and ‚Äúnationalist‚Äù.
The exchange was prompted after Ms Conway was pressed about why she went on television to claim President Trump had ‚Äúfull confidence‚Äù in Michael Flynn, his national security advisor, hours before he resigned from the White House.
Lib Hypocrisy rushed to defend Ms Conway after the interviewer told she wasn‚Äôt making ‚Äúsense‚Äù.
@KellyannePolls Your strength & resiliency in face of vile hatred, bigotry, & sexism of the unhinged Left is a daily inspiration! Love you!üèÖ
‚Äî Lib Hypocrisy üê∏ (@TrumpTrainNoBrk) February 14, 2017 Ms Conway‚Äôs account retweeted the image and then sent a response saying: ‚ÄúLove you back. Happy ‚ù§‚ù§Day to the Hapless Haters‚Äù.
The white nationalist account has a Pepe the emoticon, a cartoon character which has become a symbol for white nationalism. It also claims to ‚Äúlove Geert Wilders‚Äù, a populist far-right Dutch politician who wants to close mosques in Holland, and Steve Bannon, one of Mr Trump‚Äôs chief strategists and the former executive chairman of far-right site Breitbart News.

Speaking to Buzzfeed News , who first highlighted the exchange, Ms Conway denied she had sent the tweet.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know who had access to my account," she said on Tuesday.
‚ÄúLet me see who tweeted that. That‚Äôs terrible.‚Äù
She claimed she had ‚Äúobviously‚Äù never heard of Lib Hypocrisy, saying: ‚ÄúI denounce whoever it is. It will be immediately deleted. Everybody makes mistakes.‚Äù
Read more Ivanka Trump 'rebuked Kellyanne Conway for endorsing brand on TV' White nationalism is a type of nationalism founded on the belief that white people are a race and is driven by the desire to develop and maintain a white national identity. Critics argue white nationalism exists to offer a more palatable, sanitised face for white supremacy which is not plagued with negative connotations.
This is by no means the first time the Trump team have been linked to white nationalism. Other examples include Mr Trump failing to disavow support from former Ku Klux Klan leader David Duke when pressed about it repeatedly on CNN, and then blaming a "bad earpiece‚Äù in February last year.
What‚Äôs more, in July 2015, Mr Trump‚Äôs campaign tweeted an image of himself superimposed over a picture of WWII-era Waffen-SS soldiers, and then later blamed an incident on a ‚Äúyoung intern‚Äù.
